tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 1?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: At last in the fourth year of Hijrah, Almighty God created such conditions that they were compelled to leave Madinah. During the caliphate of ‘Umar Faruq, they and some other Jewish tribes were made to leave the Arabian Peninsula
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 3?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who opposed the Prophet were destined to suffer such punishment. During the siege of the Banu al-Nadir, some trees in their gardens were cut down as a matter of military strategy
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When the enemy have fled after defeat, their possessions are considered spoils of war (ghanimah). On such occasions the booty acquired is described as abandoned property (fay’)
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse focuses on scientific facts

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 9?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: After the hijrah, the Muslims who left their native place and migrated to Madinah were in reality a burden on the inhabitants of Madinah, who were known as ‘helpers’ (ansar)
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 11?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But the hypocrites uttered these words just to incite them to rise against Muslims; they were never sincere in their offer. This has been the character of self-interested people in every age
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Their lack of awareness with regard to God creates in them a lack of consciousness of the world also. But the power of human beings is plainly visible
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse addresses only legal rulings
This verse is primarily about historical events

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 15?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The hypocrites of Madinah who instigated the Banu al-Nadir against the Muslims had evidently learnt nothing from the total defeat of the Quraysh and Banu Qaynuqa‘ tribes who shortly before that had risen against the Muslims
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Hashr, Ayah 18?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The present world is a man’s ‘today’ and the world of the Hereafter is man’s ‘tomorrow’. Believers will have the advantage only if they acknowledge realities
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The universe, by virtue of its creative meaningfulness, mirrors the attributes of God. If an individual actually realises this, he will be completely engrossed in the remembrance and praises of God
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
